22-0527.summary: WITHDRAWNRecommendation to conduct, receive, and file a Study Session and receive input from Economic Development and Finance Committee Members and members of the public regarding the final draft Blueprint 2.0, the proposed 10-year plan to create equitable economic opportunities for workers, investors, and entrepreneurs in the City of Long Beach through the year 2030.This Agenda Item was withdrawn.3.

22-0528.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a report from Economic Development staff on a recent Sales Tax Study Report for the City of Long Beach.A motion was made by Chair Mungo, seconded by Vice Chair Richardson, that the item be laid over to the next Economic Development and Finance Committee meeting.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Mungo, Richardson and Allen4.

22-0722.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a report from Economic Development staff and Dr. Seiji Steimetz from Cal State Long Beach's Office of Economic Research on recent Economic Indicators.Nick Schultz, Executive Director, Pacific Gateway Workforce Investment Network spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation.Councilwoman Allen spoke.Nick Schultz, Executive Director, Pacific Gateway Workforce Investment Network, spoke.Chair Mungo spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Mungo and Nick Schultz, Executive Director, Pacific Gateway Workforce Investment Network.Vice Chair Richardson spoke.Chair Mungo spoke.Nick Schultz, Executive Director, Pacific Gateway Workforce Investment Network, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Mungo and Nick Schultz, Executive Director, Pacific Gateway Workforce Investment Network.Councilwoman Allen spoke.A motion was made by Member Allen, seconded by Chair Mungo, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Mungo, Richardson and AllenPage 3 of 4411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMTUESDAY, JUNE 21, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE MINUTES6.
